oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The dream of Dia!kwain, before he received news of his fathers death. Further omens, etc. In the Katkop dialect by Dia!kwain (L V.-15. 5110-5146). Dia!kwain dreams that he and his father are cutting up a sheep and a Dutch man ('Boer') threatens to beat them to death for killing the sheep. Dia!kwain awakes at daybreak and tells his wife that the dream had spoken like a person, of things that would come true. Dia!kwain's mother comes to tell him his father has died. 1) See also What happens when we die, 2) This story is found in Book V-15.
